title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Amendments include the inclusion of retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and the repeal of the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act is amended to include disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. This involves striking certain subsections and paragraphs, and updating language regarding qualified retirees. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act is amended to include disability retirees with less than 20 years of service, reducing retired pay under specific conditions. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act is amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members under specific conditions. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act is amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members under specific conditions, with effective date and conforming amendments specified. SEC. 3. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service is amended to include those entitled to retired pay (other than by reason of section 12731b of this title). Computation rules are also adjusted for retirees with fewer than 20 years of service. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service is amended to include those entitled to retired pay. The amount of the payment for any month will be reduced for retirees with fewer than 20 years of creditable service if their retired pay exceeds a certain calculation based on years of service. The amendments to combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service will take effect on the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. The payment amount for retirees with less than 20 years of creditable service will be reduced if their retired pay exceeds a certain calculation based on years of service.
